meanings.definition: To remove or eliminate the stream of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to destream the water flow to fix the leak.
meanings.sent2: The technician will destream the video to improve its quality.
meanings.sent3: Trying to destream the overflowing sink was a messy task.
meanings.sent4: Her calming voice seemed to destream the chaos in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could destream the river with a flick.

meanings.definition: The act of diverting or redirecting a stream.
meanings.sent1: The destream of the river was necessary to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers planned the destream of the creek for the new bridge.
meanings.sent3: The destream of the stream caused a temporary reroute for the fish.
meanings.sent4: The destream of traffic around the accident site saved time for commuters.
meanings.sent5: The destream of the waterfall created a mesmerizing display of water.
